DataElement.preferredName: Patient Reported Outcome Problem Chest Pain Past Week Severity Score_11 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of how bad, if at all, chest pain has been a problem during the past week, including today, using an 11-point Likert scale where 0 is not a problem and 10 is as bad as possible.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Reported Outcome Problem Chest Pain Past Week Severity Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information collected directly from a patient that typically includes subjective feelings regarding symptons, functions in daily life, physical, mental, emotional, spiritual, and social well being, and satisfaction with his/her health care.:A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution._Pain in the chest.:The most recent week, including today.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Information collected directly from a patient that typically includes subjective feelings regarding symptons, functions in daily life, physical, mental, emotional, spiritual, and social well being, and satisfaction with his/her health care.:A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Past Week Severity Score Integer::11 Point Scale
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.:A number with no fractional part.::11:The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.:an ordered reference standard.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
